overview:
As a member of Intel Capitals global investment team, Alexander is responsible for the firms investments in digital media.

Alexander has managed or co-managed investments around the globe including Atom Entertainment (acquired by Viacom), BlackArrow, ChannelM (acquired by PlayNetwork), CloudUnion, Gametrust (acquired by Real Networks), Gaikai (acquired by Sony), Envivio (Nasdaq: ENVI), Exent Technologies, JoySee, Kabam, K2 Network (acquired by RHI), Trymedia (acquired by Macrovision), The Generations Network (Nasdaq: ACOM), SixApart (acquired by SayMedia), Synacor (Nasdaq: SYNC) and Xfire. Alexander currently serves on the board of directors of BlackArrow, Kabam, and Pando. In addition, Alexander currently serves as an advisor to Gamestop Corporation and was previously an advisor to Playspan (acquired by Visa). Alexander is also a member of the NVCA Corporate Venture Group Advisory Board, the Silicon Valley Boilermaker Innovation Group, and UNLVâ€™s Engineering Advisory Board.
